content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is entering.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Guys? There’s a somebody I’d like you to meet.
(A monkey jumps on to his shoulder.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oooh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: W-wait. What is that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ‘That’ would be Marcel. You wanna say hi?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, no, I don’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, he is precious! Where did you get him?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My friend Bethel rescued him from some lab.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is so cruel! Why? Why would a parent name their child Bethel?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, that monkey’s got a Ross on its ass!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, is he gonna live with you, like, in your apartment?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. I mean, it’s been kinda quiet since Carol left, so…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why don’t you just get a roommate?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nah, I dunno… I think you reach a certain age, having a roommate is kinda pathe- (Realises) …sorry, that’s, that’s ‘pathet’, which is Sanskrit for ’really cool way to live’.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is getting ready to sing. Joey is not there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So you guys, I’m doing all new material tonight. I have twelve new songs about my mother’s suicide, and one about a snowman.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Might wanna open with the snowman.
(Enter Joey)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey, Joey. Hey, buddy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, how’d it go?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahhhhhh, I didn’t get the job.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How could you not get it? You were Santa last year.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I dunno. Some fat guy’s sleeping with the store manager. He’s not even jolly, it’s all political.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So what are you gonna be?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, I’m gonna be one of his helpers. It’s just such a slap in the face, y’know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, do you guys know what you’re doing for New Year’s? (They all protest and hit her with cushions) Gee, what?! What is wrong with New Year’s?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nothing for you, you have Paolo. You don’t have to face the horrible pressures of this holiday: desperate scramble to find anything with lips just so you can have someone to kiss when the ball drops!! Man, I’m talking loud!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, for your information, Paolo is gonna be in Rome this New Year, so I’ll be just as pathetic as the rest of you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, you wish!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s just that I’m sick of being a victim of this Dick Clark holiday. I say this year, no dates, we make a pact. Just the six of us- dinner.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah, okay. Alright.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I was hoping for a little more enthusiasm.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Woooo! Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, you’re on.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, oh, good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, hi. Ladies and gentlemen, back by popular demand, Miss Phoebe Buffay. Wooh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks, hi. Um, I wanna start with a song that means a lot to me this time of year. (Shakes bell as an introduction) (Sung:)
(Cut to later. Everyone is totally depressed by now.)
(Over the sound of Phoebe singing we hear two scientists, Max and David, having a noisy discussion)
Excuse me, excuse me! Yeah, noisy boys! (They stop talking and look up) Is it something that you would like to share with the entire group?

content.speaker: Max
content.text: No. No, that’s- that’s okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, c’mon, if it’s important enough to discuss while I’m playing, then I assume it’s important enough for everyone else to hear!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That guy’s going home with a note!

content.speaker: David
content.text: Noth- I was- I was just saying to my-

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Could you speak up please?

content.speaker: David
content.text: Sorry, I wa- I was just saying to my friend that I thought you were the most beautiful woman that I’d ever seen in my- in my life. And then he said that- you said you thought
content.parenthetical: Stands up and speaks more loudly

content.speaker: Max
content.text: Daryl Hannah.

content.speaker: David
content.text: Daryl Hannah was the most beautiful woman that he’d ever seen in his life and I said yeah, I liked her in Splash, a lot, but not so much in- in Wall Street, I thought she had kind of a

content.speaker: Max
content.text: Hard quality.

content.speaker: David
content.text: -hard quality. And uh, while Daryl Hannah is beautiful in a conventional way, you are luminous with a kind of a delicate grace. Then, uh, that-that-that’s when you started yelling. (Sits down)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, we’re gonna take a short break. (Goes over to their table)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, that guy’s going home with more than a note!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone except Joey is decorating for Christmas.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come here, Marcel. Sit here. (Marcel wanders off)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, I can’t believe he hasn’t kissed you yet. I mean God, by my sixth date with Paolo, I mean he had already named both my breasts! …Ooh. Did I just share too much?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just a smidge.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: David’s like, y’know, Scientist Guy. He’s very methodical.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think it’s romantic.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Me too! Oh! Did you ever see An Officer and a Gentleman?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, he’s kinda like the guy I went to see that with. Except, except he-he’s smarter, and gentler, and sweeter… I just- I just wanna be with him all the time. Day and night, and night and day… and special occasions…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute, I see where this is going, you’re gonna ask him to New Year’s, aren’t you. You’re gonna break the pact. She’s gonna break the pact.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, no, no, no, no. Yeah, could I just?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, ’cause I already asked Janice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon, this was a pact! This was your pact!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I snapped, okay? I couldn’t handle the pressure and I snapped.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, but Janice? That-that was like the worst breakup in history!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not saying it was a good idea, I’m saying I snapped!
[Joey enters, his shoes have bells on, which jingle as he walks. He is wearing a long coat.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi. Hi, sorry I’m late.
(He removes the coat to reveal an elf costume)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Too many jokes… must mock Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nice shoes, huh? (He wiggles his foot and the bells tinkle)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Aah, y’killing me!
(Marcel knocks over some kitchen tools)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross! He’s playing with my spatulas again!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, look, he’s not gonna hurt them, right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you always have to bring him here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I didn’t wanna leave him alone. Alright? We- we had our first fight this morning. I think it has to do with my working late. I said some things that I didn’t mean, and he- he threw some faeces…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, if you’re gonna work late, I could look in on him for you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, that’d be great! Okay, but if you do, make sure it seems like you’re there to see him, okay, and you’re not like doing it as a favour to me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but if he asks, I’m not going to lie.

content.description: Max and David’s lab, David is explaining something to Phoebe with the aid of a whiteboard.

content.speaker: David
content.text: …But, you can’t actually test this theory, because today’s particle accelerators are nowhere near powerful enough to simulate these conditions.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, alright, I have a question, then.

content.speaker: David
content.text: Yuh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, were you planning on kissing me ever?

content.speaker: David
content.text: Uh, that’s definitely a, uh, valid question. And, uh, the answer would be (Writes YES on the board) yes. Yes I was. But, see, I wanted it to be this phenomenal kiss that happened at this phenomenal moment, because, well, ’cause it’s you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: David
content.text: Right. But, see, the longer I waited, the more phenomenal the kiss had to be, and now we’ve reached a place where it’s just gotta be one of those things where I just like… sweep everything off the table and throw you down on it. And, uh, I’m not really a, uh, sweeping sorta fella.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, David, I, I think you are a sweeping sorta fella. I mean, you’re a sweeper! …trapped inside a physicist’s body.

content.speaker: David
content.text: Rrrreally.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah, oh, I’m sure of it. You should just do it, just sweep and throw me.

content.speaker: David
content.text: …Now? Now?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, right now.

content.speaker: David
content.text: Okay, okay, okay. (Gets ready to sweep, and then picks up a laptop computer) Y’know what, this was just really expensive. (Puts it down elsewhere. Then picks up a microscope) And I’ll take- this was a gift. (Moves it)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, now you’re just kinda tidying.

content.speaker: David
content.text: Okay, what the hell, what the hell. (Sweeps the remaining papers off the desk and grabs Phoebe) You want me to actually throw you or you-you wanna just hop?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can hop. (She hops onto the table)
(They kiss, finally)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So tell me something. What does the phrase ‘no date pact’ mean to you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, okay. It’s just that Chandler has somebody, and Phoebe has somebody- I thought I’d ask Fun Bobby.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fun Bobby? Your ex-boyfriend Fun Bobby?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know more than one Fun Bobby?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I happen to know a Fun Bob.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, here we go…
content.parenthetical: Brings Joey a mug of coffee

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh ooh ooh ooh, there’s no room for milk!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: There. Now there is.
content.parenthetical: Glances at Joey and then sips his coffee

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, so on our no-date evening, three of you now have dates.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, four.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Four.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Five.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Five. (Buries his head in his hands)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sorry. Paolo’s catching an earlier flight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, and I met this really hot single mom at the store. What’s an elf to do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, so I’m gonna be the only one standing there alone when the ball drops?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, c’mon. We’ll have, we’ll have a big party, and no-one’ll know who’s with who.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, y’know, this is so not what I needed right now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, it’s-it’s Marcel. He keeps shutting me out, y’know? He’s walking around all the time dragging his hands…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s so weird, I had such a blast with him the other night.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, we played, we watched TV.. that juggling thing is amazing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, uh… what juggling thing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: With the balled-up socks? I figured you taught him that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, it wasn’t that big a deal. He just balled up socks… and a melon…
(Max runs in)

content.speaker: Max
content.text: Phoebe. Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hi Max! Hey, do you know everybody?

content.speaker: Max
content.text: No. Have you seen David?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, he hasn’t been around.

content.speaker: Max
content.text: Well, if you see him, tell him to pack his bags. We are going to Minsk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Minsk?

content.speaker: Max
content.text: Minsk. It’s in Russia.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know where Minsk is.

content.speaker: Max
content.text: We got the grant. Three years, all expenses paid.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So when, when do you leave?

content.speaker: Max
content.text: January first.

content.description: Max and David’s lab, they are working. Phoebe knocks on the door

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: David
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: David
content.text: Hi! (Kisses her) What-what’re you doing here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, well, Max told me about Minsk, so (Puts on a fake cheery voice) congratulations! This is so exciting!

content.speaker: Max
content.text: It’d be even more exciting if we were going.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you’re not going? (Fake disappointed voice) Oh, why?

content.speaker: Max
content.text: Tell her, David. ‘I don’t wanna go to Minsk and work with Lifson and Yamaguchi and Flench, on nonononononono. I wanna stay here and make out with my girlfriend!!’ (Storms out)

content.speaker: David
content.text: Thank you, Max. Thank you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So-so you’re really not going?

content.speaker: David
content.text: I don’t know. I don’t know what I’m gonna do. I just- you decide.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh don’t do that.

content.speaker: David
content.text: Please.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no no.

content.speaker: David
content.text: No, but I’m asking-

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, but I can’t do that-

content.speaker: David
content.text: No, but I can’t-

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s your thing, and-

content.speaker: David
content.text: -make the decision-

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, um, stay.

content.speaker: David
content.text: Stay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Stay.
(He thinks for a moment and sweeps the stuff off the table)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Getting so good at that! (She hops on)

content.speaker: David
content.text: It was Max’s stuff. (They kiss)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the party has started.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I love this artichoke thing! Oh, don’t tell me what’s in it, the diet starts tomorrow! (Laughs her Janice laugh)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You remember Janice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Vividly.
(Someone knocks on the door; Monica gets it)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Sandy
content.text: Hi, I’m Sandy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sandy! Hi! C’mon in! (She enters, followed by a young boy and a younger girl)…You brought your kids.

content.speaker: Sandy
content.text: Yeah. That’s okay, right?
(Joey and Monica look at each other and shrug. Ross enters with Marcel on his shoulder)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Par-tay!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That thing is not coming in here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ‘That thing’? This is how you greet guests at a party? Let me ask you something, if I showed up here with my new girlfriend, she wouldn’t be welcome in your home?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m guessing your new girlfriend wouldn’t urinate on my coffee table.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. He was more embarrassed about that than anyone. Okay? And for him to have the courage to walk back in here like nothing happened…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright. Just keep him away from me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you. (She walks off) C’mon, Marcel, whaddya say you and I do a little mingling? (Marcel runs off) Alright, I’ll, uh… catch up with you later.
(The door opens. Rachel is standing there. Her coat is muddy and torn, her hair is dishevelled and her face is bruised. Everyone turns to look)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my gosh! Rachel, honey.. are you okay? Where-where’s Paolo?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Rome. Jerk missed his flight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And then… your face is bloated?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. Okay. I was at the airport, getting into a cab, when this woman- this blonde planet with a pocketbook- starts yelling at me. Something about how it was her cab first. And then the next thing I know she just starts- starts pulling me out by my hair! So I’m blowing my attack whistle thingy and three more cabs show up, and as I’m going to get into a cab she tackles me. And I hit my head on the kerb and cut my lip on my whistle…oh…everybody having fun at the party? (To Monica) Are people eating my dip?
[Time lapse. Monica and Rachel, fixed up somewhat, emerge from a bedroom]

content.speaker: Sandy
content.text: Y’know, when I saw you at the store last week, it was probably the first time I ever mentally undressed an elf.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, that’s, uh, dirty.

content.speaker: Sandy
content.text: Yeah.
(They almost kiss and then Joey realises her kids are staring at them)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, kids…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look at him. I’m not saying he has to spend the whole evening with me, but at least check in.
content.parenthetical: Watching Marcel play with Phoebe. To Chandler

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: There you are! Haaah, you got away from me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But you found me!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Here, Ross, take our picture. (Hands him a camera and he starts snapping) Smile! You’re on Janice Camera!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Kill me. Kill me now.
(Someone else knocks on the door. Monica looks through the spyhole)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey everybody! It’s Fun Bobby!
(Everyone cheers. Monica opens the door. Bobby is obviously very depressed)

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: Hey, sorry I’m late. But my, uh, grandfather, he- died about two hours ago. But I-I-I couldn’t get a flight out ’til tomorrow, so here I am!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Fun Bobby! Whoah! Who died?
(Monica gestures wildly behind Fun Bobby’s back)
[Time lapse. Bobby is talking about his grandfather. Everyone else is virtually in tears]

content.speaker: Fun Bobby
content.text: It’s gonna be an open casket, y’know, so at least I’ll- I get to see him again.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, I’m gonna blow this one up, and I’m gonna write ’reunited’ in glitter.
content.parenthetical: Ross is still taking their photo

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, Janice, that’s it! Janice… Janice… Hey, Janice, when I invited you to this party I didn’t necessarily think that it meant that we-

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, no. Oh, no.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry you misunderstood…

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh my God. You listen to me, Chandler, you listen to me. One of these times is just gonna be your last chance with me. (She runs off)
(Ross is still taking photos)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, will you give me the thing. (Snatches the camera)
(David is feeding Phoebe popcorn. Max walks up)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, Max!

content.speaker: Max
content.text: Yoko. (To David) I’ve decided to go to Minsk without you.

content.speaker: David
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Max
content.text: It won’t be the same- but it’ll still be Minsk. Happy New Year.(Walks off)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you alright?

content.speaker: David
content.text: Yeah, I’m fine, I’m fine.
(Phoebe leads David into a bedroom)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re going to Minsk.

content.speaker: David
content.text: No, I’m… not going to Minsk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you are so going to Minsk. You belong in Minsk. You can’t stay here just ’cause of me.

content.speaker: David
content.text: Yes I can. Because if I go it means I have to break up with you, and I can’t break up with you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yes, yes, yes you can. Just say, um, ‘Phoebe, my work is my life and that’s what I have to do right now’. And I say ‘your work?! Your work?! How can you say that?!’. And then you say, um, ‘it’s tearing me apart, but I have no choice. Can’t you understand that?’. And I say (Hits him) ‘no! No! I can’t understand that!’.

content.speaker: David
content.text: Uh, ow.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, sorry. Um, and, and then you put your arms around me. And then you put your arms around me. (He does so) And, um, and then you tell me that you love me and you’ll never forget me.

content.speaker: David
content.text: I’ll never forget you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And then you say that it’s almost midnight and you have to go because you don’t wanna start the new year with me if you can’t finish it. (They kiss) I’m gonna miss you. You scientist guy.

content.speaker: Dick Clark
content.text: Hi, this is Dick Clark, live in Times Square. We’re in a virtual snowstorm of confetti here in Times Square…
(Joey puts a blanket over Sandy’s kids)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There y’go, kids.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And then the peacock bit me. (Laughs) Please kiss me at midnight. (She leaves)
content.parenthetical: To a woman who he has clearly just met

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You seen Sandy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh. Uh, I don’t know how to tell you this, but she’s in Monica’s bedroom, getting it on with Max, that scientist geek. Ooh, look at that, I did know how to tell you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Vrrbddy, the bll is drrbing.

content.speaker: All
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The bll is drrbing!

content.speaker: Dick Clark
content.text: In twenty seconds it’ll be midnight…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And the moment of joy is upon us.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Looks like that no date pact thing worked out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Everybody looks so happy. I hate that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not everybody’s happy. Hey Bobby!
(Bobby waves and then bursts into tears. Midnight comes and everyone at the party except for the gang cheers and kisses)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I uh.. just thought I’d throw this out here. I’m no math whiz, but I do believe there are three girls and three guys right here. (Makes kiss noise)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I dunno. I don’t feel like kissing anyone tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t kiss anyone.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So I’m kissing everyone?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nonono, you can’t kiss Ross, that’s your brother.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Perfect. Perfect. So now everybody’s getting kissed but me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, somebody kiss me. Somebody kiss me, it’s midnight! Somebody kiss me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alrightalrightalright. (Kisses him. Ross takes a photo) There.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I wanted this to work so much. I mean I’m still in there, changing his diapers, pickin’ his fleas… but he’s just phoning it in. Just so hard to accept the fact that something you love so much doesn’t love you back.
content.parenthetical: Watching Marcel and talking to Rachel

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …I think that bitch cracked my tooth.
